Crimes.Crime_Name: Immigration non-compliance under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application is moot due to a stay of removal being granted
Crimes.Application_Facts: The Palkas' request for deferral was denied, leading to a judicial review; a stay of removal was granted before their removal
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed as moot
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the denial of deferral request
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Minister denied deferral request but did not carry out removal due to stay
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Denial of deferral request despite humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: A case becomes moot if intervening events extinguish the live controversy between parties
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Existence of a live controversy after grant of stay of removal
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Mootness arising from stay of removal after filing of judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Discretionary consideration by court to hear moot cases
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Stay of removal order, prior removal date, status of H&C application
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to deferral of removal under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Timing of stay relative to removal date and judicial review
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturning of deferral denial and suspension of removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Intervening stay may render judicial review moot unless live issue remains
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No ongoing harm due to stay of removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Denial of deferral request and subsequent grant of stay of removal
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court considered timing and legal effect of stay order
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Provisions governing removal and deferral under IRPA
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to pending removal status
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA relating to removal and deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Stay of removal negates practical effect of deferral denial
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No practical utility in deciding the merits given the stay

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application is moot after a stay of removal is granted
Crimes.Application_Facts: The Palkas overstayed their visa; removal was stayed after denial of deferral request
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed as moot
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign nationals who overstayed visa and sought deferral
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Minister refused to defer removal but removal stayed by authority
Crimes.Legal_Standard: A case is moot if there is no live controversy, even if broader questions remain
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Passage of removal date without enforcement action
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Mootness challenge following stay of removal
Crimes.Review_Standard: Discretion to hear cases of public importance despite mootness
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Visa expiration date, stay of removal order, status of H&C application
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on temporary resident status and removal
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on ongoing H&C assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Duration of overstay, existence of stay order, procedural posture
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal and judicial review of deferral denial
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal stay may eliminate live controversy necessary for judicial review
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No immediate risk of removal due to stay
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refusal to defer removal and subsequent grant of a stay order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed administrative timeline and legal effect of stay
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Sections of IRPA concerning authorized stay and removal
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA sections on visitor status and enforcement
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Stay of removal removes urgency despite unresolved H&C claim
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Prior jurisprudence indicates expired removal date renders issue moot
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Mootness doctrine applied where no enforceable removal action pending
